intro: Tragia catamarcensis, commonly known as the Catamarcensis burrplant, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and hairy foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a dry, dehiscent capsule that releases tiny seeds upon maturity. Tragia catamarcensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought conditions.
